title: ICE: 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value'

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
<!--
Thank you for finding an Internal Compiler Error! 🧊  If possible, try to provide
a minimal verifiable example. You can read "Rust Bug Minimization Patterns" for
how to create smaller examples.

http://blog.pnkfx.org/blog/2019/11/18/rust-bug-minimization-patterns/

-->

I'm new to Rust, and I ran into this error while trying to split one module into two submodules. I haven't spent much time yet trying to create a minimal example to replicate the error.

### Meta
<!--
If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions.
-->

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.58.1 (db9d1b20b 2022-01-20)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: db9d1b20bba1968c1ec1fc49616d4742c1725b4b
commit-date: 2022-01-20
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.58.1
LLVM version: 13.0.0

```

### Error output

```
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value', /rustc/db9d1b20bba1968c1ec1fc49616d4742c1725b4b/compiler/rustc_hir/src/definitions.rs:452:14

note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace.

error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md

note: rustc 1.58.1 (db9d1b20b 2022-01-20) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu

note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type lib

note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden

query stack during panic:
#0 [eval_to_const_value_raw] simplifying constant for the type system `control::initial_handshake::{constant#0}`
#1 [typeck] type-checking `control::initial_handshake`
#2 [typeck_item_bodies] type-checking all item bodies
#3 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate
end of query stack
```

environment. E.g. `RUST_BACKTRACE=1 cargo build`.
-->
